Title: Data Scientist Senior Manager
JD:
About the job
    


Overview
We are PepsiCo
PepsiCo is a global food and beverage leader operating in more than 200 countries with a product portfolio that includes 22 world-famous, billion-dollar brands. From Gatorade to Quaker, to LIFEWTR, to Lay’s, we make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world.
Innovation is a critical way we impact the market, as well as communities around the globe. We believe there is value in products, people, and planet. And we strive to make a difference by creating solutions that leave a lasting positive footprint.
Our culture is inspired by our employees. No two days are the same; we’re dynamic and full of passionate teams adopting new ideas through our collaborative spirit. At PepsiCo, What Makes You Unique, Makes Us Better!
Category Leadership
The Demand Accelerator (DX) team represents a transformation of Shopper Insights, Shopper Marketing, Category Leadership and Space resources supporting Sales and Marketing plans across the PepsiCo portfolio. This approach allows us to build best-in-class capabilities, develop deep functional expertise, and offer focused programs to drive growth with our customers.
In this role, you have an opportunity to make immediate impact in a dynamic and evolving food & beverage landscape. You will lead the Data Science initiatives for Shopper behavior across $12B PepsiCo business for Walmart Inc. and report into the Director of Business Intelligence and Shopper Behavior analytics. You will play a key strategic role in leading and improving analytical programs and communicating the results to key commercial team members in sales, supply chain, marketing, eComm, and the insights and advanced analytics teams. You’ll need to mine multiple sources of data including the new Walmart Luminate platform and PepsiCo proprietary data sources including sDNA, cDNA, etc. It will be critical to derive meaningful insights and translate sophisticated results or algorithms into actionable and clearly expressed conclusions that will empower the business to take action in the areas of assortment & merchandising optimization, store clustering, new product introductions, seasonal programs, shopper marketing, and pricing & promotional planning. Business knowledge, data analysis, and interpersonal skills are needed to thrive in this multi-functional leadership team.
Responsibilities
Subject matter expert on Data / Database technologies, Advanced Statistical Models / Data Science Techniques and Analytics TechnologyKey Shopper Behavior Tech Liaison with Data Engineering teams and Walmart’s Luminate teamDemonstrates use of analytic tools (R, Python, SAS) to grasp the business insights from various data sources including but not limited to the Luminate data platform, sDNA, cDNA and syndicated data sourcesLeads building and codification of analytical insights in several business domains including sales, marketing, supply chain and omnichannel to develop granular analytics and drive effectiveness for assortment & merchandising optimization, store clustering, new product introductions, seasonal programs, shopper marketing, and pricing & promotional planning.Leads the development of Power BI dashboards and delivery of highly visual dashboards in partnership with external partners, Data and Analytics, and HBS teamsBrings in a combination of analytical expertise, data and system knowledge and business insight, to answer and anticipate critical business questions and opportunities and deliver insights to the business in ways that make significant impacts.Collaborate with multi-functional teams including account teams (sales, strategy, e-comm sales, commercial insights, advanced analytics team, shopper marketing), brand, supply chain, and commercialization teams.
Note:- Covid-19 vaccination may be a condition of employment dependent on role and location. For specific information, please discuss role requirements with the recruiter
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree required; Data Science degree5+ years within the Consumer Packaged Goods or Retail industry, e-comm experience preferredDemonstrated analytical, critical thinking and thought leadership skillsHigh learning agility and curiosity – innovative mindset to think creatively on solutions development and problem solvingStrong PC skill set (Advanced Excel, PowerPoint, Word); Power BI and/or Tableau a plusAdvanced expertise with syndicated data sets (POS, Panel, Customer Loyalty Data) and high facility working with large data setsSelf-motivated to work with diverse business scenarios, prioritizing multiple priorities and have a business and consultancy mind-set, while technically (data) savvyCollaboration is essential in this role as the person will work very closely with senior leadership, account sales leads, cross-functional teams including supply chain and e-commerce, shopper marketing, commercial insights and advanced analytics teamsPeople management experience preferred although not required.Must be willing and able to travel 20-25% of the timeThe position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States. The expected salary range is $ 140,000 - $ 155,000. Bonus based on performance and eligibility; target payout is 15% of annual salary paid out annually. Paid time off subject to eligibility, including paid parental leave, vacation, sick, and bereavement. Other benefits, subject to elections and eligibility: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Health, and Dependent Care Reimbursement Accounts, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Insurance (Accident, Group Legal, Life), Defined Contribution Retirement Plan.

Title: Data Science Manager
JD:
About the job
    


Responsibilities
With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo’s leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.
The Data Science Pillar in D+A will be the organization where Data Scientist and ML Engineers report to in the broader D+A Organization. Also DS will lead, facilitate and collaborate on the larger DS community in PepsiCo. DS will provide the talent for the development and support of DS component and its life cycle within D+A Products. And will support “pre-engagement” activities as requested and validated by the prioritization framework of D+A.
Position Overview:
Your role will be to be part of growing team based in Gurgaon and Hyderabad, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.
You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of our continuous delivery of statistical/ML models. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.
You will be an internal ambassador of the team’s culture around data and analytics. You will provide stewardship to colleagues in the areas that you are an specialist or you are specializing.
Primary Accountabilities:
Lead other team members in a digital project acting as tech lead for the project.Act as a subject matter expert in one other digital project.Act as lead contributor in innovation activitiesPartner with product managers in taking DS requirements and assessing DS components in roadmaps.Partner with data scientist working on discovery, prototypes and pilot. Focus on experiment tracking.Partner with data engineers regarding data pipelines and data versioning.Coordinate work activities with IT services and vendors as required.Drive the use of the Platform toolset.Build, deploy or publish machine learning models that run efficiently in cloud pipelines.Help drive optimization, testing, and tooling to improve quality (unit tests).Monitor model performance (model decay), working with data scientists assessing bias and fairness.Prototype new approaches and build solutions at scale.Support large-scale experimentation done by data scientists.Influence product teams through data-based recommendations.Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.Create and audit reusable packages or libraries.COVID-19 vaccination is a condition of employment for this role. Please note that all such company vaccine requirements provide the opportunity to request an approved accommodation or exemption under applicable law
Qualifications
 6+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions. 6+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques. 6+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus. 6+ years’ experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development. Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities Experience with Agile methodology for team work and analytics ‘product’ creation. Fluent in Jira, Confluence. Fluent with Azure cloud services. Certification is a plus. Fluent in git (version control) Fluent in Docker Fluent in Jenkins Fluent with design and management of APIs. Experience with K8s is a plus. Experience with working with FAIR data is a plus. Experience with Responsible AI is a plus. Experience with distributed systems is a plus. Experience with Databricks and Mlflow is a plus Experience with ELK is a plus. Experience with ML security is a plus.
Differentiating Competencies Required:
 Creative and collaborative mindsets. Translates complex technical solutions into business understanding. Creates solutions with the ability to continually prove accuracy and with a design goal of productization/ reusability.
